Every teacher is known for her qualities. A known teacher is a member of the Teachers Registration Council of Nigeria. A man can be teaching but a qualified teacher. To become a qualified teacher, you must be a member of TRCN.

This article helps you on the steps to become a known qualified teacher.

 

How to Become a Qualified Teacher.

To be certified as a qualified teacher, you must participate in the Teachers’ Professional Qualifying Examination (PQE) and pass the examination.

The requirement to Qualify for Teachers’ PQE 2024

To qualify for the Teachers’ Professional Qualifying Examination 2PQE 2024, you must satisfy the following;

  • You must be a member of the Teachers Registration Council of Nigeria (TRCN)
  • You must be holders of Certificate in Education (NCE, B.Ed, PGDE, M.Sc(Ed), Ph.D.)
  • You must be a Nigerian

How to Register with TRCN 2024.

Registering as a member through the Teachers Registration Council of Nigeria TRCN is the yardstick to qualifying as a professional teacher. This gives you good ground to defend your teaching profession.

Procedures for TRCN and PQE Registration 2024/2024

  • Teachers desiring to register for the Professional Qualifying Examination (PQE), are to complete the registration forms obtainable from State offices (Ministry of Education) nationwide.
  • A teacher must pay a non-refundable application fee to the TRCN TSA Account based on the category of the teacher
  • Completed registration forms must be returned with evidence (receipt) of payment of examination fees.

Category of Teachers’ payment for TRCN Registration 

Category Qualification Fees
A Ph.D. holders in Education or with Education qualification 5000
B Masters in Education or Masters in other fields with Education qualification 4000
C Degree in Education or Degree in other fields with Education qualification 3500
D NCE 3000

Note:

  • That the exam application fee does not cover the cost for Registration.
  • Candidates who passed the examination will still pay the registration fee for eventual registration as professional teachers.
  • On the remitta portal candidate are to click on “PQE application fee”

How to Pay for TRCN Registration (Exams) 2024

  • Go to remita.net
  • Click the Pay TSA & States button
  • Click FGN: Federal Government of Nigeria
  • On who do you want to pay: type Teachers Registration Council of Nigeria
  • Name of Service/Purpose: select Professional Qualifying Examination Application Fee
  • Provide your correct details and click submit
  • Make a payment online/Bank, print out  proof of payment from the bank or online or email)
  • Proceed to TRCN OFFICE with the following Credentials.

Document to Submit TRCN Registration Form 2024

  • 2 recent passports,
  • Photocopies each of Certificate,
  • Birth certificate/Affidavit,
  • State/LGA of Origin certificate and
  • SSCE/NECO cert

TRCN 2024 Examination Date and Venue Nationwide  

Examination Venue and Date Will Be Communicated To Candidates

Preparing to Write TRCN Exams 2024

The Teachers Professional Qualifying Examinations (PQE) conducted by TRCN contains questions set to test teachers of their knowledge of the teaching profession. Such questions come in different categories.

Some sample questions are given as and Answers provided below.

For teachers to pass the PQE test is to have a full view of the format of how TRCN questions 2024 is set.

The questions are drawn from different sources of TRCN questions bank and solved by experienced qualified teachers.

Take a look at the TRCN sample questions extracted from years of the examination for your confirmation;

  1. In 1771 which of the following researcher propounded that the blind could read and write by using his/her fingers?
    a)Nightingale
    b)Valentine Haye
    c)Iean Itard
    d)Marcus Haye
  2. Professional prerequisites to practice as a teacher excludes
    a)Possession of professional certificate
    b)Possession of practicing license
    c)Possession of subject qualification and teaching qualification
    d)Possession of good higher degrees
  1. Which of the theories most emphasize the teacher’s role
    a)Cognitive
    b)Behaviorism
    c)Gestalt
    d)Instructional Theory
  2. In the library, the call number is critical to
    a)Lending
    b)Shelving
    c)Retrieval
    d)Cataloguing
  3. The key components of defining intellectual retardation exclude which of these variables
    a)Nomenclature
    b)Intellectual Function
    c)Systems Support
    d)Adaptive Behavior
  4. A test whose expected learning outcome is limited to the WAEC curriculum is called
    a)Achievement test
    b)Norm-referenced test
    c)Standard test
    d)Teacher made test
  5. Plato believes that ultimate reality is
    a)Knowledge
    b)Virtue
    c)Poison
    d)Physical things
  6. The bi-system classification of the curriculum is the—
    a)Assignment Of Subjects To Different Classes
    b)Assignment Of Learners Into Classes
    c)Assignment Of Teachers Into Different Subjects
    d)Assignment Of Subjects Into Time
  7. Which of the following wrote “My Pedagogical Creed?’
    a)John Dewey
    b)John Locke
    c)Aristotle
    d)Plato
  8. Which of the following special need disability classification is most difficult to identify and define?
    a) intellectual disability
    b)Learning disability
    c)emotional disability
    d)autism
